data.title: Radio Andy
data.meta_description: Created by Andy Cohen, this is fun, uncensored entertainment spanning everything in pop culture, celebrities and much more. Listen on SiriusXM!
data.text:
Entertaining, uncensored and unpredictable, each Thursday take a trip to Sandyland with actress and comedian, Sandra Bernhar …

Entertaining, uncensored and unpredictable, each Thursday take a trip to Sandyland with actress and comedian, Sandra Bernhard as she talks with celebrity guests and uses her trademark wit and humor to catch you up on her latest life happenings.

Each Thursday award-winning journalist, Gayle King invites listeners to call in as she unpacks the week's biggest headlines …

Each Thursday award-winning journalist, Gayle King invites listeners to call in as she unpacks the week's biggest headlines and highlights its brightest moments.

The Smith Sisters host a special Radio Andy Town Hall with the cast and director of the new Prime comedy, Jackpot! John Cena …

The Smith Sisters host a special Radio Andy Town Hall with the cast and director of the new Prime comedy, Jackpot! John Cena, Awkwafina, Simu Liu and Paul Feig.

Pour yourself a cocktail with Watch What Happens Live producers, John Jude & Melissa France, as they fill you in on all the …

Pour yourself a cocktail with Watch What Happens Live producers, John Jude & Melissa France, as they fill you in on all the behind-the-scenes hijinx and drama - from the control room to the clubhouse!

Harlem-grown TV personality, businesswoman and social media raconteur Bevy Smith is giving it to you straight, no chaser eve …

Harlem-grown TV personality, businesswoman and social media raconteur Bevy Smith is giving it to you straight, no chaser every Friday, offering an unfiltered look inside her booked, blessed, and busy life.

The team behind The Eyes of Tammy Faye, Party Monster, Million Dollar Listing, RuPaul's Drag Race, and more countdown the to …

The team behind The Eyes of Tammy Faye, Party Monster, Million Dollar Listing, RuPaul's Drag Race, and more countdown the top "ten things that make us go WOW" in pop culture.

Come for the gratitude, stay for the attitude! The John Hill Show is your destination for everything in John's universe. Fro …

Come for the gratitude, stay for the attitude! The John Hill Show is your destination for everything in John's universe. From the latest pop culture news to current obsessions join John and his guests every Tuesday as they break it all down; with light, love, and a shadiness to kill.

This is the show that goes on in my head, when the cameras stop rolling. I get to ask the questions that I really want to kn …

This is the show that goes on in my head, when the cameras stop rolling. I get to ask the questions that I really want to know and talk to friends and experts about the topics I really want to discuss. It's unfiltered, often unhinged...it's Let's Talk Off Camera with Kelly Ripa.

Jeff Lewis is host of the highly acclaimed SiriusXM show Jeff Lewis Live on Radio Andy, and is widely regarded as America’s most well-known house flipper through his role in Bravo’s docuseries Flipping Out, which aired for 11 seasons. After renovating his own properties for 20+ years, Lewis launched his design firm in 2009. By 2010, Lewis was chosen to design the House Beautiful magazine Kitchen of the Year displayed at Rockefeller Center in New York. Lewis developed his own line of all-natural stone field and mosaic tiles available exclusively at The Home Depot.

Also appears on The Jeff Lewis Channel

John Hill is a writer, producer, show runner, director, and performer. He can be heard Monday and Wednesday mornings live on air as Andy Cohen’s cohost on SiriusXM’s Andy Cohen Live, as well as hosting his own weekly show The Feels. After joining the Broadway National Tour of Miss Saigon, Hill landed roles in the original Broadway casts of Hairspray and The Boy From Oz (with Hugh Jackman), and originated the role of Jason in the New York cast of Bare. Hill created and developed two documentary series that were sold to MTV (MTV Show Choir and Making It), which led to a long list of TV writing/producing credits (Project Runway, Top Chef, Kathy Griffin: My Life On The D List, and Not Today, Bianca with Bianca Del Rio). He spent several years as the writer/producer of the late-night hit, Watch What Happens Live With Andy Cohen on Bravo. Hill currently is President of Development at Marci Klein Productions.

Lauren Ashley Smith is the Head Writer and Co-Executive Producer of the Emmy-nominated series A Black Lady Sketch Show on HBO, and co-host of SiriusXM’s Smith Sisters Live on Radio Andy. Primarily a comedy writer and producer, her credits include Best Week Ever on VH1, The Rundown with Robin Thede on BET, and Fashion Queens and Watch What Happens Live with Andy Cohen on Bravo. As an actor, she has appeared in The Characters and Between Two Ferns: The Movie on Netflix.

Mariah Smith is a full-time writer and comedian, as well as a producer and co-host of SiriusXM’s Smith Sisters Live on Radio Andy. She’s well known for her pop culture knowledge and has been following and writing about the Kardashians for more than five years. In her wildly popular column_, Keeping Up With the Kontinuity Errors,_ she explores the production inconsistencies on the family’s main show and spinoffs. While she is the go-to Kardashian expert, Smith is also a regular entertainment, celebrity, and TV contributor for a variety of publications including, The New York Times, Time magazine, GQ, Cosmopolitan, and more. Smith also served as a writer for the Fox sitcom Outmatched. In addition, she’s worked as a producer on late night television shows, such as Watch What Happens Live with Andy Cohen, The Rundown with Robin Thede, and Fashion Queens.

Rachel Smith is a social media and communications professional in higher education, and co-host of SiriusXM’s Smith Sisters Live on Radio Andy. Before retiring from the entertainment industry after a decade, Rachel was the social media manager for Sesame Street and its parent company where she established an online presence for many of the program’s beloved characters, including Elmo, Big Bird, and Cookie Monster. In addition to Sesame, Rachel formerly called TIDAL, VH1, and SiriusXM her professional home.

Sandra Bernhard is a performer, actress, singer, and author. She is the host of SiriusXM’s Sandyland, her weekly radio show on Radio Andy, for which she won a Gracie Award. A pioneer of the one-woman show, Bernhard is known for bringing her unique and raucous mix of cabaret, stand-up, rock ’n‘ roll, and social commentary to the stage. Bernhard’s film credits include The King of Comedy (for which she was awarded Best Supporting Actress by the National Society of Film Critics), Hudson Hawk, and the live performance film Without You I’m Nothing. Television credits include Pose, American Horror Story: Apocalypse, Sweetbitter, and Roseanne.

Melissa France is currently the Supervising Producer of Bravo’s Watch What Happens Live with Andy Cohen, overseeing show creative including silly games like “Toss That Salad” and “What’s In the Ball Sack?”…she loves a raunchy title! She can be heard every Friday, along with pal John Jude as the co-host of Radio Andy’s Here’s What Happened Live. Getting her start as a production assistant on Nickelodeon’s Slime Time Live she moved to New York City to become an Associate Producer at U Pick Live, later working at MTV producing celebrity interviews, musical performances, and red carpets for the network. After years of working on these exciting events, she landed her dream job at Bravo as a Segment Producer at her favorite Late Night talk show.

John is the Co-Executive Producer of Watch What Happens Live with Andy Cohen, overseeing all creative aspects of the show, including developing the infamous “Plead the Fifth” segment. His favorite time of week is Fridays at 11 AM ET when he gets together with Melissa France to dissect the weekly on-and-off-air shenanigans of WWHL on Radio Andy’s Here’s What Happened Live. John Jude started his career as a production assistant on MTV’s flagship live show, Total Request Live, in the height of the Backstreet Boys and *NSYNC era. After several years of rabid screaming fans outside the Times Square windows, he worked his way up to Producer and eventually moved to London to launch TRL UK (more indie rock, less unbridled enthusiasm). Shortly after moving back to the states, John joined Bravo’s Watch What Happens Live with Andy Cohen, in 2010 and thirteen years and over 2500 episodes later he’s seen it grow from airing one lonely night a week to serving up pop-culture moments five nights a week.

LaKendra Tookes is a Southern girl, born in Georgia, traveled the world as a military brat, graduated from the University of Florida (Go Gators!) and eventually found her way to Los Angeles, where she fit right in after a lifetime of being ridiculed for talking like a valley girl. LaKendra has worked as a writer, actress, TV host and comedian. She's written for Saturday Night Live and been a correspondent for Access Hollywood. And now every Wednesday is KEN’s Day over on Reality Checked as she passionately and hilariously chats about all her favorite shows and gossip in the reality world. When she’s not watching her fav reality shows, she’s watching lots of classic TV, listening to 80’s music and yacht rock or playing with her sweet dog, Savvy. But her absolutely favorite thing to do is SHOP, so if you see her at the mall say, Hey Girl!!
